name: campaigning
content:

present participle of
campaign
C1 to organize a series of activities to try to achieve something: [ + to infinitive ] They've been campaigning for years to get him out of prison. He's spending a lot of his time at the moment campaigning for/on behalf of the Conservative Party. They're busy campaigning against the building of a new motorway near here.
More examplesFewer examplesThey campaign for the rights of the unborn child.We campaigned on a platform of low taxation.She has campaigned relentlessly for her husband's release from prison.She campaigned for women's rights during the 1960s.The group is campaigning to get more women into politics.
